title: Proteome-Wide and Immune Cell Phenotype Mendelian Randomization Highlights Immune Involvement in Genetic Generalized Epilepsy.
abstract: Genetic generalized epilepsy (GGE) involves polygenic inheritance, with emerging evidence implicating immune mechanisms in seizure pathogenesis. Unlike previous studies focusing on inflammation following seizures, we employed an integrative multi-omics approach to identify precipitating immune factors in GGE development.
